comments:
Also see bug 149146:
Select a (small) file on a remote dstore connection, choose "Copy"
Select a folder on a Windows-Local subsystem, choose "Paste"
Do the same again --> Dialog will ask for overwrite

It happened to me once that I saw the following NPE (was not reproducible, might eed multiple tries to reproduce).

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.cacheRemoteFile(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:1530)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.cacheRemoteFile(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:1544)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.local.model.LocalFileAdapter.convertToRemoteFiles(LocalFileAdapter.java:61)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.listFoldersAndFiles(FileServiceSubSystem.java:322)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.listFoldersAndFiles(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:907)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveOneFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:798)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:773)
at org.eclipse.rse.core.subsystems.SubSystem$ResolveRelativeJob.performOperation(SubSystem.java:1462)
at org.eclipse.rse.core.subsystems.SubSystem$SubSystemOperationJob.run(SubSystem.java:1332)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I can not reproduce this problem.

Please reopen if reproducible.
